titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Thomas C. South, Indictment
CWG4786

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Breckenridge Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against. } Indict. for unlawful Shooting at another with intent to kill such person without inflicting a wound
Thomas C South

The Grand Jury of Breckinridge County in the Name & by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse Thomas C. South of the crime of unlawfully Shooting at another with intent to kill such person without inflicting a wound committed as follows viz The said Thomas C South in the County afsd on the day of Octo in the year 1861 did unlawfully with a gun loaded with powder & lead or other hard substance Shoot at ThmS William H Hoskins with the intent to kill him the said Hoskins but without inflicting a wound upon him against the peace & dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky
John Chapeze Atto for the Commonwealth of Ky. "Protem"

Witnesses
Wm J Scott
Jno L Randolph
A G Elliott
Wm H Hoskins
Wm H Hoskins Senr.
A Copy Attest G. P. Jolly clk
BCC

Commonwealth vs } Copy Indictment
Tho C South
